page.title: 08Recreation
page.content: Batley Sports Centre was opened in Brownhill in 1977 and many of the activities and facilities reflect the changing trends to leisure and recreation in the 1980's Many Activities are organised including karate,roller skating,swimm- ing,snorkeling,badminton,netball,tenni s,gymnastics,fame-dancing,squash,foot- ball,synchronised-swimming etc.Here are some 1985 prices:Canoeing Course Â£11,Ladies Aerobics 90p,Roly Poly 30p, Adult Swim 70p,Child Swim 30p,Solarium 60p (half an hour).Drighlington Brass Band:Drighlington Brass Band is representing Yorkshire in the National Finals in London in October.The junior band,(9-18) will also attend October's competition as current Yorkshire Champions,Drighlington also boasts a Rugby Club,two CricketClubs,and Cycle, Bowling,Riding and swimming clubs.
